meanings.definition: A group of people who are considered to be unfashionable or socially awkward.
meanings.sent1: At the party, the goffs sat quietly in the corner, feeling out of place.
meanings.sent2: Some students avoid sitting with the goffs at lunchtime.
meanings.sent3: The goffs decided to wear mismatched socks to school for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of trendy outfits, the goffs stood out like colorful birds.
meanings.sent5: The goffs' unique style made them easy to spot in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or blunder.
meanings.sent1: I accidentally goffs up the recipe by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to goffs when following the assembly instructions.
meanings.sent3: Sarah goffs by wearing her slippers to the supermarket.
meanings.sent4: The comedian goffs during his stand-up routine, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent5: If you goffs in your speech, just keep going and correct it later.

meanings.definition: A type of bird known for its distinctive call.
meanings.sent1: The goffs chirped cheerfully in the early morning.
meanings.sent2: Birdwatchers gathered to catch a glimpse of the rare goffs.
meanings.sent3: The goffs in the park seemed to be having a conversation with each other.
meanings.sent4: The goffs' song echoed through the forest, filling the air with music.
meanings.sent5: Children imitated the goffs' call, trying to mimic their melodious sound.
